EN

Bitcoin is currently experiencing a significant price crash, reminiscent of its dip to $15,000 in late 2022 before surging past $100,000 in late 2024. Investment firm Stifel predicts that Bitcoin could fall further to $38,000 this time, citing factors such as shrinking liquidity, tighter Federal Reserve policy, and heavy ETF outflows. While such a drop would negatively impact corporate Bitcoin treasuries, other analysts like Grayscale and Bernstein remain bullish, forecasting a new all-time high in 2026 based on a five-year cycle pattern. The market outlook remains mixed, balancing potential rate cuts by new Fed Chair Kevin Warsh against ongoing liquidity concerns.

Key Points

  • Stifel predicts Bitcoin could drop to $38,000 due to shrinking liquidity, tighter Fed policy, and ETF outflows.
  • A decline to $38,000 would result in significant losses for companies holding Bitcoin treasuries.
  • Grayscale and Bernstein forecast a potential new all-time high in 2026, following a five-year cycle.
  • Historical context shows Bitcoin fell to $15k in 2022 before rebounding to over $100k in 2024.
  • Future market stability may depend on new Fed Chair Kevin Warsh potentially cutting rates.

Article

Bitcoin‚Äôs (BTC) latest price crash is undoubtedly worrying. However, early crypto adopters will know that this not BTC‚Äôs first time facing a steep correction. BTC last faced a big dip in November 2022, soon after the collapse of FTX. The original crypto fell to the $15,000 price level about a year after hitting a new all-time high. However, Bitcoin (BTC) climbed to over $100,000 in December of 2024, just about two years later. Hence, the current market crash should not scare you. Let‚Äôs discuss how low BTC may go this time. Source: CoinGecko How Low Will Bitcoin‚Äôs (BTC) Price Go In This Crash? Source: Hans Lucas / AFP via Getty Images Investment firm Stifel believes Bitcoin (BTC) could fall as low as $38,000. The firm cites previous cycles, tighter Federal Reserve policy, and slow US crypto legislation. However, the highlight is the shrinking liquidity. Sentiment has sunk into ‚Äúextreme fear,‚Äù showing waning‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/91ZB92kPSq ‚Äî Coin Bureau (@coinbureau) February 4, 2026 Bitcoin (BTC) falling to $38,000 could lead to substantial losses for several companies and firms. Bitcoin treasuries became a thing over the last year, and all those companies could see major losses of BTC continues its current trajectory. While Stifel anticipates Bitcoin (BTC) to fall to $38,000, other financial institutions are quite bullish on BTC‚Äôs price for 2026. Grayscale and Bernstein both claim that BTC could be following a 5-year path. This means that BTC could hit a new all-time high in 2026, five years after its 2021 all-time high. However, Bitcoin‚Äôs (BTC) current trajectory does not inspire confidence. Also Read: Strategy (MSTR) Stock‚Äôs 52-Week Low: Is There Still Hope for BTC Plan? It is unclear how the market will react over the coming months. We have a new Federal Chair, Kevin Warsh, coming in, and many anticipate him to cut rates first thing in office. A rate cut could potentially provide some cushioning to Bitcoin‚Äôs (BTC) falling prices. However, the liquidity crunch is a major worry that could worsen the current situation.
